contentrichtext.text: {{unsourced|date=January 2009}} {{Chinese |t=楊祚 |s=杨祚 }} {{chinese name|[[Yang (surname)|Yang]]}} '''Yang Zuo''' was a military general serving under the warlord [[Gongsun Yuan]] during the [[Three Kingdoms]] period of [[History of China|Chinese history]]. In 238, he led a front of troops along with [[Bei Yan]] during [[Sima Yi]]'s [[Sima Yi's Liaodong campaign|Liaodong campaign]] against Gongsun. Yang then engaged Sima during a protracted battle, but ended up being lured out by Sima and defeated. He then escaped into Xiangping (襄平), Gongsun's headquarters, and surrendered to Sima when the city was under siege. ==See also== *[[List of people of the Three Kingdoms]] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Yang, Zuo | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Chinese general | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Yang, Zuo}} [[Category:Gongsun Yuan and associates]] {{China-bio-stub}}
